channel.title: Height Issues
channel.description:
http://www.pwnds.info/newpwnds/admin.php You see how it only goes so far? I don't know what attribute(s) I'd have to set to get it to extend as the text does. (The reason why it's just blank space at the bottom is because it's just a bunch of
's.) I've been trying quite a few things and can't seem to get anywhere. If you need more info, let me know.

item.title: Height Issues
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:13, topic:152411”]IIRC, I did

#body { height:auto; width:700px; }[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Height Issues
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

Did you get it how you want it yet? If not, try height: auto;

-Alexia

item.title: Height Issues
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:16, topic:152411”]At first glance, I thought you were complaining that you were short.

Anyway, the problem is fixed? Should the menubar on the left extend to the bottom also, or is it fine as it is?[/quote]Yeah, that also has to extend, but I have figured out a fix for that, I think.

Haven’t had the time to work on it, but I’ll get there.

Read full topic

item.title: Height Issues
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

That’s what I was thinking, however I decided to try something else first.

Here’s what I got:

body { background:#003466 none repeat scroll 0%; font-family:tahoma,arial; font-size:11px; font-weight:normal; line-height:15px; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; } #container { background:#FFFFFF url(images/top.jpg) no-repeat scroll center top; margin:0pt auto; min-height:100%; width:700px; } #header { height:80px; margin-left:5px; margin-right:5px; padding-top:5px; width:700px; } #right { text-align:right; width:100px; } #nav { background:transparent url(images/lowbg.png) repeat-x scroll center bottom; height:34px; margin-bottom:2px; width:700px; } #nav ul { display:block; list-style-image:none; list-style-position:outside; list-style-type:none; margin:0px; padding:0px; } #nav li { background:transparent url(images/buttonbg.jpg) repeat-x scroll 0%; color:#FFFFFF; display:block; float:left; height:25px; list-style-image:none; list-style-position:outside; list-style-type:none; margin-right:2px; padding-top:10px; text-align:center; width:90px; } #nav a:link, #nav a:visited { color:#FFFFFF; font-weight:700; text-decoration:none; } #body { height:auto; width:700px; } #sidenav { background:#0D5DAB url(images/navtop.jpg) no-repeat scroll center top; color:#FFFFFF; height:auto; left:0px; min-height:300px; position:relative; top:4px; width:197px; } .big { background:#003466 none repeat scroll 0%; border-left:0.1em solid #0D5DAB; border-right:0.2em solid #0D5DAB; font-size:18px; font-weight:400; height:24px; margin-bottom:2px; padding-top:5px; text-align:center; } .text { padding-bottom:5px; padding-left:7px; padding-top:5px; } .text a:link, .text a:visited { color:#FFFFFF; } #main { left:210px; padding-left:6px; position:relative; width:450px; margin-top:-45%; } #footer { background:transparent url(images/lowbg.png) repeat-x scroll center top; margin-top:4px; text-align:center; width:700px; } #line2 { background:#003466 none repeat scroll 0%; height:3px; left:0px; position:relative; top:0px; width:700px; } #admin { height:22px; text-align:right; width:700px; } h1 { font-size:24px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; } h2 { font-size:14px; margin-bottom:0px; text-align:center; } td { vertical-align:top; } table.black, table.black td { border:1px solid black; } #tah { border:1px solid black; font-weight:bold; text-align:center; } .photo { height:640px; padding-right:5px; width:480px; } .center { color:#FFFFFF; text-align:center; }

I’m not sure if that is what you wanted or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Height Issues
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

I think the problem is when you have it set too 100% it stays at 100% of your screens dimensions, even when you have it with the min-height. try setting it to a fixed height… id remcomend 450px;

#main {
width: 450px;
position: relative;
top: -596px;
left: 210px;
padding-left: 6px;
min-height: 450px;
}

Read full topic

Since I use coordinate positioning?

's.)

What do you mean by “it only goes so far”? It looks fine to me…
